title: How to Play osu!

steps.headline: Register.
steps.description: Go to osu.ppy.sh, then go to the upper right hand side. Click "register".

steps.headline: Create an account.
steps.description: Create an account for osu! with your username, email, and password.

steps.headline: Install the client.
steps.description: Click the first hyperlink to start download.The osu! site provides information on how to download the client.

steps.headline: Enter your credentials that you've made previously onto the client.
Click on the huge osu!
steps.description: circle. This circle is in the center of the screen.

steps.headline: Click on the "Play" button.
steps.description: This is the first option on the menu.

steps.headline: Scroll to a song that you want to play.
steps.description: When you find a song you want to play, click on it, then click on "osu! ".

steps.headline: Click on the circles.
steps.description: When the ring closes around the circle, click on it. This will count as a hit. You should see a green or blue number when this happens.

steps.headline: Drag the sliders.
steps.description: When the ring closes around the circles on the sliders, click and move your cursor to stay aligned with the slider circle/ball. If you see an arrow pointing in the opposite direction, then move your cursor back to the start. You may have to oscillate on the slider for a while.

steps.headline: Spin the spinners.
steps.description: When a spinner appears, click your mouse and move it in circles as fast as you can. The faster you spin, the more points you can get.

steps.headline: Use a touchscreen or touchscreen with stylus.
steps.description: Instead of using your mouse which cannot move fast enough, use your PC's touchscreen for similar or better results.

steps.headline: Consider using the Z and X keys instead of clicking your mouse.
steps.description: Not only will you be able to click faster when you get used to this, but you can forget about the awkwardness of clicking your mouse repeatedly.

steps.headline: Get a tablet.
steps.description: No, not an iPad! A tablet is an input device with a stylus that uses absolute positioning, similar to your touchscreen. You can find more information here.

steps.headline: Turn on mods.
steps.description: To do so, click on the "Mods" button on the bottom toolbar in the song selection menu, and choose how you would like to modify your gameplay. This will also change your multiplier, depending on whether your mods will make your gameplay easier or harder.

steps.headline: Download a skin.
steps.description: osu! is a skinable game; the default skin is full of distractions. Choose a skin that is clean, flat, epic, and/or not as distracting as the other skins.

text:
Installation and Registration Register. Go to osu.ppy.sh, then go to the upper right hand side. Click "register". Create an account. Create an account for osu! with your username, email, and password. Install the client. Click the first hyperlink to start download.The osu! site provides information on how to download the client. Open the application. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/58\/Osu4.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/58\/Osu4.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":421,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":694.798927613941,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Enter your credentials that you've made previously onto the client. Time to get started! Playing the Game Click on the huge osu! circle. This circle is in the center of the screen. Click on the "Play" button. This is the first option on the menu. Scroll to a song that you want to play. When you find a song you want to play, click on it, then click on "osu! ". Click on the circles. When the ring closes around the circle, click on it. This will count as a hit. You should see a green or blue number when this happens. Drag the sliders. When the ring closes around the circles on the sliders, click and move your cursor to stay aligned with the slider circle/ball. If you see an arrow pointing in the opposite direction, then move your cursor back to the start. You may have to oscillate on the slider for a while. Spin the spinners. When a spinner appears, click your mouse and move it in circles as fast as you can. The faster you spin, the more points you can get. Becoming Better Use a touchscreen or touchscreen with stylus. Instead of using your mouse which cannot move fast enough, use your PC's touchscreen for similar or better results. Consider using the Z and X keys instead of clicking your mouse. Not only will you be able to click faster when you get used to this, but you can forget about the awkwardness of clicking your mouse repeatedly. Get a tablet. No, not an iPad! A tablet is an input device with a stylus that uses absolute positioning, similar to your touchscreen. You can find more information here. Turn on mods. To do so, click on the "Mods" button on the bottom toolbar in the song selection menu, and choose how you would like to modify your gameplay. This will also change your multiplier, depending on whether your mods will make your gameplay easier or harder. Download a skin. osu! is a skinable game; the default skin is full of distractions. Choose a skin that is clean, flat, epic, and/or not as distracting as the other skins.
